STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
August 05, 2025
Frederick Walraven
ENNIS CENTER FOR CHILDREN - Williamston
1288 W Grand River Ave, Suite 100
Williamston, MI, 48895-8305
Re: License #: CB330410104
Dear Mr. Walraven:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
06/30/2025. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action
plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Sanantha Way, Area Manager, at 517-243-9743.
Sincerely,
Sincerely,
Pinkey Brown, Licensing Consultant
2

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the following:
CPA Rule 400.12418 Development of service plans
• (5) An agency shall involve the child's parent or
parents and the foster parents in the development
of service plans to enable the parent or parents
and foster parents to understand the plan for the
child and the parents' and the foster parent's role
in assisting the agency in carrying out the plan. An
agency shall give a copy to and review the parent-
agency treatment plan with the parent or parents
and foster parents. The agency must inform the
parent or parents and foster parent that the
information in the parent-agency treatment plan
and any other information about the child and the
child's family is confidential.
Three of six foster care case files and one independent living case file reviewed did
not indicate that the plan was developed with the parent/parents or foster parents to
enable the parent/parents/foster parents to understand the plan.
CPA Rule 400.12605 Adoptive family evaluation
• (1) An agency social service worker shall
complete a written adoptive evaluation within 90
2

days of the family signing an adoption application
and prior to approving a family for adoption.
Three of three adoptive family files reviewed did not complete the family evaluation
within the 90 days of the signed application.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
2024 RENEWAL, CAP APPROVED 5/14/2024
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• Technical Assistance was not requested or required.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• Consultation was not requested or required.
VI. EVALUATION OF PERIOD UNDER REVIEW
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance:
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plan (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with the individual CAP is as follows:
The agency submitted a corrective action plan for their Renewal Inspection dated
5/1/2024, and the CAP was approved on 5/14/2024. The agency was in violation
with Rule 400.12605 – 1, Adoption family evaluation, and policy 722-08D,
Treatment plans-Agreement and signatures. The agency has a repeat violation
for Rule 400.12605 Adoption family evaluation.
Chief Administrator Assessment:
Chief Administrator (CA) Assessment was discussed onsite on 6/30/2025 with the
Chief Administrator. He reported the barriers and systemic factors that impacted
rules, policy and contract compliance were that the previous corrective action plan
(CAP) was not successful due to high staff turnover and processes not being
followed. He reported he has a full staff now and the agency will be able to move
forward by providing training to the rules that were in noncompliance. He reported
on the previous CAP oversight and improvement stating that it has provided
supervisory guidelines to improve compliance and tracking with departmental
3

reports to assist with the task completion due dates and reminders. He reported
the staff were provided with the CAP and all staff are engaged in a refresher
course of training on rules and policies for all staff who remain at the agency and
for newly hired staff.
Financial Overview:
Reviewed the agency independent auditor’s report dated 9/30/2024, and annual
financial budget. There were no financial concerns identified.
Staff Interviews:
Three staff members interviewed onsite on 6/30/2025. The staff interviewed have
worked for the agency for two years or two months. All three of the staff reported
receiving the supervision, support and training needed to learn and complete their
job responsibilities. No concerns were reported.
Description of Agency Walk Through:
The agency has adequate space and equipment to complete required
responsibilities. Files and CHRI are stored securely in a manner that prevents
unauthorized access within metal locked cabinets and drawers and behind locked
doors.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
There was one safety alert.
Safety Alert: A safety plan was created due to the lake behind an unlicensed
caregiver having no safety plan. There was no safety plan on the 3130A form.
Resolution: A 3130A addendum was created on 6/12/2025, to address the lake
behind the home. The safety plan consists of having a life preserver ring
accessible, life jacks, caregiver being informed when foster child is outside. A life
preserver ring was provided to the home by the agency. A photo is attached of
the preserver ring for review.
4

VIII. RECOMMENDATION:
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
7/15/2025
_________________________________________________________________
Pinkey Brown Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
08/05/2025
__________________________________________________________________
Samantha Way Date
Area Manager
5
